cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds help maintain overall biodiversity by supporting plant reproduction and dispersal.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes to maintaining or sustaining the state or level of the object over time.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Pathway: via plant reproduction and colonization

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Maintaining and protecting bird populations helps maintain biodiversity.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes causally to maintaining or preserving the state, integrity, or level of the object (e.g., biodiversity).

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: ecosystems around the world; natural systems
qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when bird populations are effectively protected along with their habitats
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: if bird populations and their habitats are protected

remarks: Relation direction chosen as bird populations (when protected) contributing to biodiversity maintenance.
Relation direction chosen as bird populations (when protected) contributing to biodiversity maintenance.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Protecting bird habitats is important for maintaining biodiversity.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes causally to maintaining or preserving the state, integrity, or level of the object (e.g., biodiversity).

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when habitats are protected along with bird populations
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: if bird populations and their habitats are protected

remarks: Created to separately capture the effect of habitat protection.
Created to separately capture the effect of habitat protection.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes causally to maintaining or preserving the state, integrity, or level of the object (e.g., biodiversity).
args.justification: All three relations describe causal contributions (birds, bird populations, or habitats) to maintaining biodiversity as a conservation outcome. The first relation should share the same canonical predicate description, relation class, and CAUSALITY group as the other two for schema consistency.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject contributes causally to maintaining or preserving the state, integrity, or level of the object (e.g., biodiversity).
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe causal contributions (birds, bird populations, or habitats) to maintaining biodiversity as a conservation outcome. The first relation should share the same canonical predicate description, relation class, and CAUSALITY group as the other two for schema consistency.
